passages.text: USA|P&C Insurance/Insurtech
Aspen Insurance Holdings
Equity ResearchAugust 29,2025
Downgrading to Hold Following Acquisition Announcement

Following this week's agreement for AHL to be acquired by Sompo at $37.50/share ($3.5bn value), we're downgrading shares to Hold (from Buy). The all-cash deal represents a 1.2x P/B ex AOCI multiple (~8x '26 Cons EPS) and is expected to close 1H26.

**Transaction details**: Sompo will Buy AHL for $3.5bn or $37.50 per share. The price represents a 36% premium to unaffected share price as of 8/19/25 and 25% premium over 30-day VWAP.Shareholders representing more than a majority of the issued common shares gave consent approving the merger agreement. We note AHL previously went private in 2018 for $2.6bn (1.1x P/B). Bermuda/Reinsurance M&A multiples have been in the 1.0-1.4x P/B range over the last decade (see table).

FY (Dec)CHANGE TO JEFeJEF vs CONS2025202620252026REVNANANANAEPSNANANANA2025($)Q1AQ2AQ3Q4 FYEPS0.561.220.931.17 3.85PREV

Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 5-10 of this report. \(*JefferiesLLC/JefferiesResearchServices,LLC\)

We view AHL as well positioned to deliver mid- teens returns in a shifting pricing environment supported by mix (60% Insurance / 40% Reinsurance NPW split), as well as diversified product exposure and its fee- generative third- party capital business. We model slightly stronger reported combined ratios relative to Bermudian peers and expect growth to be relatively in line with peers. We expect a stable/improving ROE profile on scale, lower CAT, earned pricing, and higher NII.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Pricing moderates over next year- Loss trends stable- Flattish NPW growth- Negative underlying margin expansion- Low-teens Op ROE- BVPS ex AOCI: \(\) 35.96\(/Target multiple: 1.0x / Price Target:\) \ \(37.50\)

- Pricing momentum continues over next year- Loss trends moderating- Flattish NPW growth- Negative underlying margin expansion- Mid-teens Op ROE- BVPS ex AOCI: \(\) 41.30\(/Target multiple: 1.2x / Price Target:\) \ \(50\)

- Pricing declines faster than anticipated- Loss trends deteriorate- Flattish NPW growth- Negative underlying margin expansion- High-single digit Op ROE- BVPS ex AOCI: \(\) 31.30\(/Target multiple: 0.8x / Price Target:\) \ \(25\)

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Physical impacts of climate change: In an underwriting capacity, AHL is exposed to loss events (though it is slightly more weighted to Casualty & Specialty than Property) that are increasing in frequency/severity. 2) Systemic risk management: balancing both growth and risk exposure requires diligent management of individual and aggregated risks; underwriting practices must be robust, and oversight of program managers must be thorough.

Company targets: 1) have \(>91\%\) of GPW rated at least "neutral" and \(>66\%\) rated "favorable" in its internal ESG framework. 2) reducing or offsetting greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across Scope 1- 3 emissions.

Question(s) for management: 1) How are you balancing premium growth and climate exposure (catastrophe or otherwise) with pricing and terms & conditions to maintain sustainable client relationships? 2) How are you managing climate exposure with rate and T&C actions in the property portfolios?
- Mid-year and year-end reinsurance renewals- Full-year earnings results and industry reserve data- Quarterly reports- Potential follow-on offerings of stock
**Exhibit 1 - Reinsurance M&A valuation table** **C**
Bermuda/Reinsurance M&A valuations have been in the 1.4x P/B range over the last decade

Exhibit 2 - AHL model
Source: Company data, Jefferies

Aspen is a Bermuda- based insurer and reinsurer with a third- party capital management division that generates fee income. The company writes property, casualty, and specialty exposures across its insurance and reinsurance divisions. The company was founded in 2002 and was public from 2003- 2019 before being taken private. The company re- entered the public markets in May 2025 after a successful turnaround that focused on reducing volatility and re- underwriting portions of the business.

Our price target is established by applying a target multiple of 1.0x to our Q2G6 BVPS ex AOCI estimate. Downside risks include weaker- than- expected premium growth, deteriorating underwriting margins, or deteriorating loss cost trends in Property or Casualty lines that could limit BVPS compounding. Upsides risks include pricing momentum continuing, loss trends moderating, and accelerating BVPS growth.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed
Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries make a market in the securities or ADRs of Aspen Insurance Holdings Ltd.

Within the past twelve months, Aspen Insurance Holdings Ltd has been a client of Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries and investment banking services are being or have been provided.

Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries has acted as a manager or co- manager in the underwriting or placement of securities for Aspen Insurance Holdings Ltd or one of its affiliates within the past twelve months.
Within the past 12 months, Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries has received compensation from investment banking services from Aspen Insurance Holdings Ltd.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period.

The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10 is 20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus 20% within a 12-month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below\) 10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus 20% or less within a 12-month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.

CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company. Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations. Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Aspen Insurance Holdings Ltd (AHL: \(36.55, HOLD)

**Notes:** Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
